main event: An unidentified spherical object resembling Venus was sighted near Guam on 27 February 1961, believed to be a meteor.
interesting points: The object had a white then reddish color, It left a trail 30-50 times its diameter, Duration of the observation was too short for a satellite, The object was noted to have characteristics of a meteoric sighting, It was concluded to be either a natural phenomenon or possibly an astronomical event.
sighted object: spherical object with a reddish trail
witness description: Sighted by LTJG R.E. Stewart, co-pilot, considered reliable.
